## BART Model 

```{r}
library(dbarts)
library(dplyr)

set.seed(42)

# Simulation Parameters
nburn <- 1000
nsim <- 1000
num_rep <- 50
sample_sizes <- c(250, 500)
mu_types <- c("linear", "nonlinear")
tau_types <- c("homogeneous", "heterogeneous")

results_list <- list()
idx <- 1

for (n in sample_sizes) {
  for (mu_type in mu_types) {
    for (tau_type in tau_types) {
      for (rep in 1:num_rep) {
        cat(sprintf("Rep %d | n = %d | mu = %s | tau = %s\n", rep, n, mu_type, tau_type))

        tryCatch({
          # Step 1: Generate covariates
          X1 <- rnorm(n)
          X2 <- rnorm(n)
          X3 <- rnorm(n)
          X4 <- rbinom(n, 1, 0.5)
          X5 <- sample(c(1, 2, 3), n, replace = TRUE)
          X <- data.frame(X1, X2, X3, X4, X5)

          # Step 2: Treatment effect
          tau <- if (tau_type == "homogeneous") rep(3, n) else 1 + 2 * X$X2 * X$X5

          # Step 3: Prognostic function (fixed g_X4 logic)
          g_X4 <- ifelse(X$X4 == 1, 2, -1)
          mu <- if (mu_type == "linear") {
            1 + g_X4 + X$X1 * X$X3
          } else {
            -6 + g_X4 + 6 * abs(X$X3 - 1)
          }

          # Step 4: Propensity and treatment assignment
          s_mu <- sd(mu)
          u <- runif(n)
          pi <- 0.8 * pnorm((6 * mu / s_mu) - 0.5 * X$X1) + 0.05 + u / 10
          pi <- pmax(0, pmin(1, pi))
          Z <- rbinom(n, 1, pi)
          eps <- rnorm(n)
          Y <- mu + tau * Z + eps

          # Step 5: Fit BART
          dat <- data.frame(Y, Z, X)
          x.train <- as.matrix(dat[, c("Z", "X1", "X2", "X3", "X4", "X5")])
          y.train <- dat$Y

          bart_fit <- bart(x.train = x.train,
                           y.train = y.train,
                           keeptrees = TRUE,
                           nskip = nburn,
                           ndpost = nsim,
                           ntree = 200,
                           verbose = FALSE)

          # Step 6: Generate counterfactual predictions
          newdata_control <- data.frame(Z = 0, X1 = X$X1, X2 = X$X2, X3 = X$X3, X4 = X$X4, X5 = X$X5)
          newdata_treatment <- data.frame(Z = 1, X1 = X$X1, X2 = X$X2, X3 = X$X3, X4 = X$X4, X5 = X$X5)

          pred_control <- predict(bart_fit, newdata = as.matrix(newdata_control))
          pred_treatment <- predict(bart_fit, newdata = as.matrix(newdata_treatment))

          # Step 7: Compute treatment effects
          tau_samples <- pred_treatment - pred_control  # nsim x n
          tau_hat <- colMeans(tau_samples)
          ate_hat <- mean(tau_hat)
          ate_true <- mean(tau)

          rmse_ate <- sqrt((ate_hat - ate_true)^2)
          rmse_cate <- sqrt(mean((tau_hat - tau)^2))

          lower_cate <- apply(tau_samples, 2, quantile, probs = 0.025)
          upper_cate <- apply(tau_samples, 2, quantile, probs = 0.975)
          coverage_cate <- mean(tau >= lower_cate & tau <= upper_cate)
          length_cate <- mean(upper_cate - lower_cate)

          ate_samples <- rowMeans(tau_samples)
          ci_ate <- quantile(ate_samples, probs = c(0.025, 0.975))
          coverage_ate <- as.numeric(ate_true >= ci_ate[1] & ate_true <= ci_ate[2])
          length_ate <- ci_ate[2] - ci_ate[1]

          results_list[[idx]] <- data.frame(
            rep = rep, n = n,
            mu_type = mu_type, tau_type = tau_type,
            rmse_ate = rmse_ate,
            rmse_cate = rmse_cate,
            coverage_ate = coverage_ate,
            coverage_cate = coverage_cate,
            length_ate = length_ate,
            length_cate = length_cate
          )
          idx <- idx + 1

        }, error = function(e) {
          cat("⚠️ Error in iteration. Skipping...\n")
        })
      }
    }
  }
}

# Summarize results
results <- do.call(rbind, results_list)

summary_results <- results %>%
  group_by(n, mu_type, tau_type) %>%
  summarise(
    ATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_ate),
    ATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_ate),
    ATE_Length = mean(length_ate),
    CATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_cate),
    CATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_cate),
    CATE_Length = mean(length_cate),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

print(summary_results)
save(summary_results, file = "summary_results_BART.RData")
```


## BCF Model 

```{r}
set.seed(42)

# Parameters
nburn <- 1000
nsim <- 1000
num_rep <- 50
sample_sizes <- c(250, 500)
mu_types <- c("linear", "nonlinear")
tau_types <- c("homogeneous", "heterogeneous")

results_list <- list()
idx <- 1

for (n in sample_sizes) {
  for (mu_type in mu_types) {
    for (tau_type in tau_types) {
      for (rep in 1:num_rep) {
        cat(sprintf("Rep %d | n = %d | mu = %s | tau = %s\n", rep, n, mu_type, tau_type))

        tryCatch({
          # Step 1: Generate covariates
          X1 <- rnorm(n)
          X2 <- rnorm(n)
          X3 <- rnorm(n)
          X4 <- rbinom(n, 1, 0.5)
          X5 <- sample(c(1,2,3), n, replace = TRUE)
          X <- data.frame(X1, X2, X3, X4, X5)

          # Step 2: Treatment effect
          tau <- if (tau_type == "homogeneous") rep(3, n) else 1 + 2 * X$X2 * X$X5

          # Step 3: Prognostic function (fixed bug in g_X4)
          g_X4 <- ifelse(X$X4 == 1, 2, -1)
          mu <- if (mu_type == "linear") {
            1 + g_X4 + X$X1 * X$X3
          } else {
            -6 + g_X4 + 6 * abs(X$X3 - 1)
          }

          # Step 4: Propensity & treatment assignment 
          s_mu <- sd(mu)
          u <- runif(n)
          pi <- 0.8 * pnorm((6 * mu / s_mu) - 0.5 * X$X1) + 0.05 + u / 10
          pi <- pmax(0, pmin(1, pi))
          Z <- rbinom(n, 1, pi)
          eps <- rnorm(n)
          Y <- mu + tau * Z + eps

          # Step 5: Fit BCF
          fit <- bcf(y = Y, z = Z,
                     x_control = as.matrix(X),
                     x_moderate = as.matrix(X),
                     pihat = pi,
                     nburn = nburn,
                     nsim = nsim)

          tau_samples <- fit$tau
          tau_hat <- colMeans(tau_samples)
          ate_hat <- mean(tau_hat)
          ate_true <- mean(tau)

          rmse_ate <- sqrt((ate_hat - ate_true)^2)
          rmse_cate <- sqrt(mean((tau_hat - tau)^2))

          lower_cate <- apply(tau_samples, 2, quantile, probs = 0.025)
          upper_cate <- apply(tau_samples, 2, quantile, probs = 0.975)
          coverage_cate <- mean(tau >= lower_cate & tau <= upper_cate)
          length_cate <- mean(upper_cate - lower_cate)

          ate_samples <- rowMeans(tau_samples)
          ci_ate <- quantile(ate_samples, probs = c(0.025, 0.975))
          coverage_ate <- as.numeric(ate_true >= ci_ate[1] & ate_true <= ci_ate[2])
          length_ate <- ci_ate[2] - ci_ate[1]

          results_list[[idx]] <- data.frame(
            rep = rep, n = n,
            mu_type = mu_type, tau_type = tau_type,
            rmse_ate, rmse_cate,
            coverage_ate, coverage_cate,
            length_ate, length_cate
          )
          idx <- idx + 1

        })
      }
    }
  }
}

results <- do.call(rbind, results_list)

summary_results <- results %>%
  group_by(n, mu_type, tau_type) %>%
  summarise(
    ATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_ate),
    ATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_ate),
    ATE_Length = mean(length_ate),
    CATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_cate),
    CATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_cate),
    CATE_Length = mean(length_cate),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

print(summary_results)
save(summary_results, file = "summary_results_BCF.RData")
```

## GLM S-Learner Model 

```{r}
set.seed(42)

# Parameters
num_rep <- 50
sample_sizes <- c(250, 500)
mu_types <- c("linear", "nonlinear")
tau_types <- c("homogeneous", "heterogeneous")

results_list <- list()
idx <- 1

for (n in sample_sizes) {
  for (mu_type in mu_types) {
    for (tau_type in tau_types) {
      for (rep in 1:num_rep) {
        cat(sprintf("[GLM S-Learner] Rep %d | n = %d | mu = %s | tau = %s\n", rep, n, mu_type, tau_type))

        tryCatch({
          # Step 1: Generate covariates
          X1 <- rnorm(n)
          X2 <- rnorm(n)
          X3 <- rnorm(n)
          X4 <- rbinom(n, 1, 0.5)
          X5 <- sample(c(1,2,3), n, replace = TRUE)
          X <- data.frame(X1, X2, X3, X4, X5)

          # Step 2: Treatment effect
          tau <- if (tau_type == "homogeneous") rep(3, n) else 1 + 2 * X$X2 * X$X5

          # Step 3: Prognostic function
          g_X4 <- ifelse(X$X4 == 1, 2, -1)
          mu <- if (mu_type == "linear") {
            1 + g_X4 + X$X1 * X$X3
          } else {
            -6 + g_X4 + 6 * abs(X$X3 - 1)
          }

          # Step 4: Propensity & treatment assignment 
          s_mu <- sd(mu)
          u <- runif(n)
          pi <- 0.8 * pnorm((6 * mu / s_mu) - 0.5 * X$X1) + 0.05 + u / 10
          pi <- pmax(0, pmin(1, pi))
          Z <- rbinom(n, 1, pi)
          eps <- rnorm(n)
          Y <- mu + tau * Z + eps

          # Step 5: Fit GLM S-Learner
          training_data <- data.frame(Z = Z, X, Y = Y)
          glm_model <- lm(Y ~ ., data = training_data)  # simple linear regression

          # Step 6: Predict potential outcomes
          X_new <- data.frame(X)
          X_treated <- data.frame(Z = 1, X_new)
          X_control <- data.frame(Z = 0, X_new)

          Y1_hat <- predict(glm_model, newdata = X_treated)
          Y0_hat <- predict(glm_model, newdata = X_control)

          tau_hat <- Y1_hat - Y0_hat
          ate_hat <- mean(tau_hat)
          ate_true <- mean(tau)

          # Step 7: Metrics
          rmse_ate <- sqrt((ate_hat - ate_true)^2)
          rmse_cate <- sqrt(mean((tau_hat - tau)^2))

          # Approximate 95% credible intervals (GLM is not Bayesian, so fake intervals using repeats)
          tau_samples_dummy <- matrix(tau_hat, nrow = 1000, ncol = n, byrow = TRUE)
          lower_cate <- apply(tau_samples_dummy, 2, quantile, probs = 0.025)
          upper_cate <- apply(tau_samples_dummy, 2, quantile, probs = 0.975)
          coverage_cate <- mean(tau >= lower_cate & tau <= upper_cate)
          length_cate <- mean(upper_cate - lower_cate)

          ate_samples <- rowMeans(tau_samples_dummy)
          ci_ate <- quantile(ate_samples, probs = c(0.025, 0.975))
          coverage_ate <- as.numeric(ate_true >= ci_ate[1] & ate_true <= ci_ate[2])
          length_ate <- ci_ate[2] - ci_ate[1]

          results_list[[idx]] <- data.frame(
            rep = rep, n = n,
            mu_type = mu_type, tau_type = tau_type,
            rmse_ate, rmse_cate,
            coverage_ate, coverage_cate,
            length_ate, length_cate
          )
          idx <- idx + 1

        })
      }
    }
  }
}

results <- do.call(rbind, results_list)

summary_results <- results %>%
  group_by(n, mu_type, tau_type) %>%
  summarise(
    ATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_ate),
    ATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_ate),
    ATE_Length = mean(length_ate),
    CATE_RMSE = mean(rmse_cate),
    CATE_Coverage = mean(coverage_cate),
    CATE_Length = mean(length_cate),
    .groups = "drop"
  )

print(summary_results)
save(summary_results, file = "summary_results_GLM_SLearner.RData")
```
